comments:
An internal error occurred during: "Update Manager".

Details->>
java.lang.NullPointerExeption
Could you please provide more information as to what you were doing?

when i tried to add Web Tools for phpeclipse from this adress http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/updates/, i got this error in the middle of updating. It didn't occure at the start or the end of updating. I tried two or three times.

Now, i set up Fedore Core 5, and i completed all the updates of FC5. In the setup, i selected the eclipse to install. After installation, i add Phpeclipse from Eclipse Software Update menu. It finished succesfully. After, by the same way, i tried to install webtools. Bu i couldn't.

Before, i used FC4, but i never used phpeclipse on eclipse with FC4.

Thanks for your help.
Can you please attach your log? Also can you provide any other information about your system or network?

I'm suspecting this issue might be related to Bug 145235:

- I've disabled automatic mirror selection 
- Help->Software Updates->Find&Install
- Search For New Features->Callisto Discovery Site->OK
- Select GEF/EMF->OK

Again, update fails:

!MESSAGE

I believe this is due to 144070, at least in my case. After retrying the update without proxy (which delivered stale information), installation went fine.
Remaining issue would be that the log file/ dialogs do not provide enough detail to diagnose the problem.

Andreas, update cannot give you more information if your proxy is not working correctly (not letting you through, giving stale info....) proxies are not visible to update and as your log shows we get 404, which is "resource not available" http status code. The only place where update has any knowledge of proxies is when you set up your proxy data and we are setting system properties based on it.

Well understood. But if the ressource is not available, the error message should contain information about the ressource (URL) and not look like this:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-06-10 05:05:29.614
!MESSAGE Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.RuntimeException:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: protocol = http host = null)
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable
(java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: protocol =
http host = null)
Any more thoughts on this? I still believe we should tell the user *which* resource isn't available... Otherwise please lets close as wontfix?

traces.message: Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/features/org.eclipse.gef_3.2.0.v20060529.jar.
